comments.body: IMO we should always use `gcc`, but some Mac people throw stones at me when I say that. You can do this but be aware that your package may be incompatible with the rest of the `conda-forge` stack that uses `clang`.

I had to do this to make it compatible with the ipopt-feedstock which is compiled with gcc for linux and osx. Should I raise an issue there? Seems like it would need to be fixed there first. Or can I compile this with clang even though the main dependency, ipopt, is compiled with gcc? The package uses pkg-config to grab the linker info from ipopt and this contains `-lgcc_eh` which fails with clang.
That is up to you. But be sure po either `clang` or `gcc` on both.
